{"step_by_step_thinking": "Gluconeogenesis is the process of synthesizing glucose from non-carbohydrate sources. Pyruvate carboxylase, PEP carboxykinase, and Glucose-6-phosphatase are all enzymes involved in this process. However, Pyruvate kinase is involved in glycolysis, the breakdown of glucose, not gluconeogenesis.", "answer_choice": "C. Pyruvate kinase"}
